thread.title: What Happens to Your Body If You Hang Upside Down for Too Long
thread.title_full: What Happens to Your Body If You Hang Upside Down for Too Long

author: Patrick Allan
title: What Happens to Your Body If You Hang Upside Down for Too Long
text:
If you’ve ever wondered if hanging upside down for too long can kill you, the answer is yes. Here’s what happens to your body if you don’t get it upright in time. Advertisement 
In this video from the SciShow YouTube channel , Olivia Gordon explains the science of the upside down human body, and what can go wrong. When you go inverse, blood begins to rush to your head as soon as you flip over. Eventually, that can cause a blood vessel to rupture or trigger a brain hemorrhage. But that’s not the biggest problem. Most complications are caused by asphyxiation, or the lack of oxygen. When you’re upside down, your organs put extra weight on your lungs, making it harder to breathe. Heart problems can also arise because you have a lot more blood flowing toward your heart, meaning your heart has to pump harder than usual. And dangling for too long is bad for your eyes too. The pressure inside your eye can double when you’re upside down, which can cause vision problems. 
Of course, you’d have to be stuck hanging upside down for a few hours or more for most of these things to happen, so there’s no need for kids to avoid the monkey bars entirely. But if you’re hanging up some Christmas lights , going climbing, or doing some work up in high places, make sure someone else is around just in case.
